poem:
"Ode to Dissent"

Upon the Barnsley road,
a leader, aloft, waves.
(His stance, his speech, bestowed)
Cast from work site shadows,
two objets d'art take flight.
For every action, reaction's light.
Shout not in malice, but in respite,
the protester's call resounds in twilight.

A public order, they insist,
yet in this public sphere, 
quiet dissent persists.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man arrested after objects thrown at Nigel Farage in Barnsley A 28-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of a public order offence after Nigel Farage had objects hurled at him while campaigning in Barnsley. The Reform UK leader was waving to local people from the top of the party’s battlebus in South Yorkshire on Tuesday morning when two separate objects were thrown at him. A protester could be seen shouting from a work site". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Man arrested after objects thrown at Nigel Farage in Barnsley A 28-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of a public order offence after Nigel Farage had objects hurled at him while campaigning in Barnsley. The Reform UK leader was waving to local people from the top of the party’s battlebus in South Yorkshire on Tuesday morning when two separate objects were thrown at him. A protester could be seen shouting from a work site
